definitions.definition: An elevation of land of considerable dimensions rising more or less abruptly , forming a conspicuous figure in the landscape, usually having a small extent of surface at its summit .
examples: Everest is the highest mountain in the world.
We spent the weekend hiking in the mountains .
We collected plant specimens from mountain meadows above 2000 meters.

definitions.definition: Something very large in size or quantity; a huge amount ; a great heap .
examples: He was a real mountain of a man, standing seven feet tall.
There's still a mountain of work to do.

definitions.definition: Wine from Malaga made from grapes that grow on a mountain.

main_definition: ( countable ) An elevation of land of considerable dimensions rising more or less abruptly , forming a conspicuous figure in the landscape, usually having a small extent of surface at its summit . [from 12th c.]
secondary_definitions: ( countable ) Something very large in size or quantity; a huge amount ; a great heap . [from 15th c.]
( figuratively ) A difficult task or challenge.
( uncountable , now historical ) Wine from Malaga made from grapes that grow on a mountain. [from 18th c.]
( countable , slang ) A woman 's large breast .
